Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix: Resolve plugin configuration conflict

Move skills and hooks from marketplace.json to plugin.json to fix
"conflicting manifest" error. Marketplace entry now only specifies
source, while plugin.json contains the complete component definitions.

This fixes the EXDEV cross-device installation error caused by
configuration conflicts.

 Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix: Resolve plugin installation EXDEV error

Restructure plugin configuration to fix cross-device link error:
- Remove skills/hooks references from plugin.json \(metadata only\)
- Move hooks.json to independent hooks/ directory  
- Add version/description to marketplace.json plugins array
- Fix .gitignore to include scripts/*.js files
- Add missing vibesurf-health-check.js to git

This aligns with working plugin structures \(claude-mem, superpowers\).
The EXDEV error was caused by plugin.json referencing components
directly, and large node_modules causing rename failures.

 Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Build: Add compiled JavaScript files for plugin distribution

- Build TypeScript to JavaScript in skills/surf/dist/
- Update .gitignore to include compiled files \(dist/*.js\)
- Exclude node_modules from plugin distribution

This follows the pattern used by claude-mem: commit compiled code,
not node_modules. The plugin runs the compiled JS directly without
needing build tools installed.

Development workflow:
1. Make changes to .ts files
2. Run: npm run build \(from root\) or cd skills/surf && npm run build
3. Commit both .ts sources and compiled .js files
4. Delete node_modules before plugin installation testing

 Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Fix: Resolve plugin installation EXDEV error

Restructure plugin to fix cross-device link error:
- Move all plugin code to plugin/ subdirectory
- Update marketplace.json source to ./plugin \(from ./\)
- Add plugin.json in plugin/.claude-plugin/
- Update .gitignore to exclude development artifacts

This aligns with working plugin structures \(claude-mem\).
The EXDEV error was caused by marketplace.json source:"./"
which attempted to copy the entire root directory including
node_modules during plugin installation.

New structure:
- .claude-plugin/marketplace.json \(metadata only\)
- plugin/.claude-plugin/plugin.json \(plugin config\)
- plugin/hooks/ \(hooks directory\)
- plugin/scripts/ \(scripts directory\)
- plugin/skills/ \(skill code and dist\)

 Generated with [Claude Code]\(https://claude.com/claude-code\)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
